title: The Tormented Soil nerfs will cripple Morgana's mid lane viability
body:
I choose Morgana in the mid lane when I want strong crowd control at the expense of damage.  Right now, out of 49 mid laners that champion.gg has compiled data about, Morgana is **38th place** for total damage dealt, **33rd place** for killing spree frequency, **40th place** for total gold earned and **30th place** for total minions killed.

Clearly, the data shows Morgana is a champion that struggles with damage output (when played in the mid lane.)

Let's look at the potential impacts of having Tormented Soil do less damage in the earlier stages of the game:

**Support Morgana**
- Loses about 10 damage depending on how many soil ticks the enemy takes.
- No change to her interaction with Spellthief's Edge.

**Mid lane Morgana**
- Her average farm per game will go down as she's going to miss lots of minions to her own minions in between soil ticks, since each tick is individually weaker.
- Since her soil is amplified by a percentage depending on missing health, Morgana will actually lose more damage than is shown on the PBE.
- Morgana loses a chunk of damage towards champions as her real damage source is Tormented Soil, not the binding or shackles.
- Morgana has to max her soil rather than get 3 points in it and then max her binding.

There is also the fact that your Tormented soil becomes useless for farming as soon as your team groups for objectives.  Many times I've put my 130 mana cost pool down under some minions only to have an ADC last hit every single one of them with a well placed skillshot.  It is incredibly hard to farm as Morgana past 20 minutes for this reason.

Morgana is already one of the weakest champions at gold generation and damage output in the mid lane.  The Tormented Soil nerfs will only exacerbate these weaknesses of hers, and for no reason, because she's not even picked as a mid laner in competitive play.

I hope they don't because there's a significant difference between Janna and Morgana.  One is meant to primarily be a support.  The other is primarily meant to be a mid laner.

I agree though, they're probably just balancing her around the pros (who don't play Morgana because of her lack of reliable damage) who only play her as a support.

At this point, she's basically transitioned into a primary support.  And to be fair, in her prime, mid Morg was a pain. AFK pushing, resilience  to poking thanks to her passive, and Black Shield made it a pain to gank her.

I don't know, I've actually seen a few pros play Morgana mid or top within the last few months. *Personally*, I think it makes sense to cement Morgana into a support role. That role revolves heavily around Dark Binding (her main "true" skillshot) and using Black Shield on diverse targets, rather than Tormented Soil and self-shielding. That role feels more interesting to me than solo Morgana, and there are more viable mids than supports.

The disclaimer: I play support Morgana, not solo lane. So I'm probably reacting less negatively because of that. I still think the changes make sense, though, and shouldn't hurt support Morgana too badly (her ranked solo winrate is like 51% so it's not like they're kicking her while she's down). I think the only really negative thing about this change (which is true for a lot of nerfs) is that I agree it really will hurt the viability of solo lane Morgana, and it feels crappy to have that happen to a champion you've devoted many hours to learning. (Still, the execute damage and AP ratios aren't being touched.) I main Syndra; I know.
